Install and configure Meridian in your React project
A React component library with an industrial manufacturing aesthetic. Sharp edges, monospace typography, and safety-signal colors.

import { Badge, Button, Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent } from 'meridian';
Preview
## Features - **Industrial Aesthetic** Design language inspired by manufacturing contexts: safety markings, machine surfaces, and technical documentation - **Monospace Typography** Clean, technical typography that fits the industrial theme - **Dark Mode** Automatic dark mode support with carefully tuned colors - **Zero Runtime** Pure CSS styling with data attributes, no JavaScript overhead - **TypeScript First** Full type definitions with JSDoc documentation - **Accessible** Built with accessibility in mind, proper focus states and ARIA support

import { Badge } from 'meridian';
import PropTable from '../../../components/PropTable.astro';
import ComponentPreview from '../../../components/ComponentPreview.astro';

The Badge component displays a small label for status indicators, categories, or counts.

<ComponentPreview>
  <Badge client:load>Default</Badge>
  <Badge variant="success" client:load>Success</Badge>
  <Badge variant="warning" client:load>Warning</Badge>
  <Badge variant="danger" client:load>Danger</Badge>
  <Badge variant="info" client:load>Info</Badge>
</ComponentPreview>

## Import

```tsx
import { Badge } from 'meridian';
```

## Props

<PropTable component="badge" />

## Usage

### Basic

```tsx
<Badge>Label</Badge>
```

### Variants

Use the `variant` prop to indicate different statuses:

```tsx
// Default neutral badge
<Badge>Default</Badge>

// Operational/success state
<Badge variant="success">Operational</Badge>

// Warning/caution state
<Badge variant="warning">Caution</Badge>

// Error/danger state
<Badge variant="danger">Critical</Badge>

// Informational
<Badge variant="info">Info</Badge>
```

<ComponentPreview label="Status Variants">
  <Badge client:load>Default</Badge>
  <Badge variant="success" client:load>Operational</Badge>
  <Badge variant="warning" client:load>Caution</Badge>
  <Badge variant="danger" client:load>Critical</Badge>
  <Badge variant="info" client:load>Info</Badge>
</ComponentPreview>

### Real-World Examples

```tsx
// System status
<Badge variant="success">Online</Badge>
<Badge variant="danger">Offline</Badge>

// Priority labels
<Badge variant="danger">High Priority</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Medium</Badge>
<Badge>Low</Badge>

// Categories
<Badge variant="info">Documentation</Badge>
<Badge variant="info">Tutorial</Badge>
```
Interactive button with multiple visual intents

import { Button } from 'meridian';
import PropTable from '../../../components/PropTable.astro';
import ComponentPreview from '../../../components/ComponentPreview.astro';

The Button component provides a clickable element with different visual intents for various actions.

<ComponentPreview>
  <Button intent="primary" client:load>Primary</Button>
  <Button intent="secondary" client:load>Secondary</Button>
  <Button intent="danger" client:load>Danger</Button>
  <Button intent="ghost" client:load>Ghost</Button>
  <Button disabled client:load>Disabled</Button>
</ComponentPreview>

## Import

```tsx
import { Button } from 'meridian';
```

## Props

<PropTable component="button" />

## Usage

### Basic

```tsx
<Button>Click me</Button>
```

### Intents

Use the `intent` prop to change the visual style based on the action type:

```tsx
// Primary action (default)
<Button intent="primary">Save changes</Button>

// Secondary action
<Button intent="secondary">Cancel</Button>

// Destructive action
<Button intent="danger">Delete</Button>

// Subtle action
<Button intent="ghost">Learn more</Button>
```

<ComponentPreview label="Intents">
  <Button intent="primary" client:load>Primary</Button>
  <Button intent="secondary" client:load>Secondary</Button>
  <Button intent="danger" client:load>Danger</Button>
  <Button intent="ghost" client:load>Ghost</Button>
</ComponentPreview>

### Disabled State

```tsx
<Button disabled>Cannot click</Button>
```

<ComponentPreview label="Disabled">
  <Button intent="primary" disabled client:load>Primary</Button>
  <Button intent="secondary" disabled client:load>Secondary</Button>
  <Button intent="danger" disabled client:load>Danger</Button>
</ComponentPreview>

import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter, Button, Badge, Text } from 'meridian';
import PropTable from '../../../components/PropTable.astro';
import ComponentPreview from '../../../components/ComponentPreview.astro';

The Card component provides a container for grouping related content with optional header and footer sections.

<ComponentPreview>
  <Card style={{ maxWidth: '320px' }} client:load>
    <CardHeader client:load>
      <CardTitle client:load>System Status</CardTitle>
      <CardDescription client:load>Current operational parameters</CardDescription>
    </CardHeader>
    <CardContent client:load>
      <Text size="sm" client:load>All systems nominal. No anomalies detected.</Text>
    </CardContent>
    <CardFooter client:load>
      <Button intent="secondary" client:load>View details</Button>
      <Button intent="ghost" client:load>Dismiss</Button>
    </CardFooter>
  </Card>
</ComponentPreview>

## Import

```tsx
import { 
  Card, 
  CardHeader, 
  CardTitle, 
  CardDescription, 
  CardContent, 
  CardFooter 
} from 'meridian';
```

## Components

The Card is composed of multiple sub-components:

| Component | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| `Card` | The main container |
| `CardHeader` | Container for title and description |
| `CardTitle` | The card's heading |
| `CardDescription` | Secondary text in the header |
| `CardContent` | Main content area |
| `CardFooter` | Footer with actions |

## Usage

### Basic Card

```tsx
<Card>
  <CardContent>
    Simple card with just content.
  </CardContent>
</Card>
```

### With Header

```tsx
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Card Title</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>Optional description text</CardDescription>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    Main content goes here.
  </CardContent>
</Card>
```

### With Footer Actions

```tsx
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Confirm Action</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>This action cannot be undone.</CardDescription>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    Are you sure you want to proceed?
  </CardContent>
  <CardFooter>
    <Button intent="danger">Confirm</Button>
    <Button intent="ghost">Cancel</Button>
  </CardFooter>
</Card>
```

<ComponentPreview label="With Actions">
  <Card style={{ maxWidth: '320px' }} client:load>
    <CardHeader client:load>
      <CardTitle client:load>Confirm Action</CardTitle>
      <CardDescription client:load>This action cannot be undone.</CardDescription>
    </CardHeader>
    <CardContent client:load>
      <Text size="sm" client:load>Are you sure you want to proceed?</Text>
    </CardContent>
    <CardFooter client:load>
      <Button intent="danger" client:load>Confirm</Button>
      <Button intent="ghost" client:load>Cancel</Button>
    </CardFooter>
  </Card>
</ComponentPreview>

### Status Card

```tsx
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Server Health</CardTitle>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>
    <Badge variant="success">Online</Badge>
    <Text size="sm">Response time: 42ms</Text>
  </CardContent>
</Card>
```
